business.headline: Sensex ends 2,000 points higher: Here's why the stock market jumped todayThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 2,072.67 points to close at 83,739.13, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 639.15 points to settle at 25,727.55. The Nifty recorded its best single-day gain since May 2025, showing a strong return of buying interest after recent weakness.

Gold and silver ETFs surge again after three-day slump. What changed today?Gold and silver may stay volatile in the near term, but today's bounce shows investors are still willing to buy dips. Whether the recovery holds will depend on global cues and key support levels.

Did you miss the India-US trade deal stock market rally? Here's what to doEarly signs of the rally were visible even before Indian markets opened. Gift Nifty jumped more than 700 points after the trade deal announcement, signalling a strong start for Dalal Street.

India–US trade deal and the big oil question: What's changing for India?India became one of the largest buyers of discounted Russian crude after 2022, a trend that helped reduce its import bill. US President Donald Trump's announcement indicates that these purchases will eventually decline, but the immediate impact is expected to be limited.

India–US trade deal announced, but why the fine print remains crucialUS President Donald Trump called the changes "effective immediately" on Truth Social, and Prime Minister Narendra Modi confirmed the development shortly afterward. Yet the absence of the actual agreement means much of the deal is being read between the lines rather than from a published document.

Silver, gold rates today: Why prices are rising after recent crashOn the Multi Commodity Exchange, silver prices jumped sharply, while gold also posted strong gains in early trade. MCX silver was trading around Rs 2,53,792 per kg, up Rs 17,531 or 7.42% as of 10 am. MCX gold was near Rs 1,49,101 per 10 grams, higher by Rs 5,110 or 3.55%.

Adani Enterprises stock surges 10% on India–US trade deal. Check top gainersThe India–US trade deal has supercharged sentiment, lifting Adani stocks and other heavyweights sharply. Here's a look at the top gainers as markets rally hard after the landmark announcement.

India-US trade deal: Why it's good news for Sensex, Nifty and the rupeeThe India–US trade deal lifts a long-standing weight off investors' shoulders, giving the Sensex, Nifty and the rupee a cleaner runway. With clarity finally restored, the market's next leg higher suddenly looks more believable.

Sensex jumps 2,500 points: 3 reasons why the stock market is rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 2,271.45 points to 83,937.54, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 691.70 points to 25,780.10 as of 9:28 am. The sharp rise came as investors reacted to clarity on the India-US trade agreement, which had remained delayed for months and was seen as a key reason behind recent market weakness.

Did India really commit $500 billion to the US, or is the number just big talk?While US President Donald Trump laid out the figure in public, the Indian government has so far not specified what such a commitment involves, raising questions over its scale, timing and credibility.

Sensex jumps 2,300 points, Nifty surges as markets cheer India–US trade dealThe India–US trade deal has given the Sensex and Nifty their strongest tailwind in months, setting the stage for what could become a far more extended market surge.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will stock market open higher on India-US trade deal?Early signals from the Gift Nifty point to a strong opening. Gift Nifty futures were trading at around 26,190 points at 8:26 am. This suggests that the Nifty 50 index could open nearly 4.5% higher than Monday's closing level of 25,088.4.

Capital gains tax on share buybacks is good for small investors. Here's whyThe government has shifted buyback taxation to a capital gains framework, while tightening rules for promoters who were seen as misusing buybacks as a tax-saving tool.

US, India seal trade deal after PM-Trump call: 5 things that changed overnightInstead of leaving the details to official statements, US President Donald Trump chose to spell out the trade deal himself, framing it as a result of personal diplomacy and immediate action.

Trump announces India trade deal, cuts tariffs to 18% after call with PM ModiAlso shedding light on the much-awaited US-India trade deal, which had faced several roadblocks with New Delhi adamant about not opening its agriculture sector to Washington, Trump said that an agreement is finally on the cards. Trump said he lowered the reciprocal tariffs following discussions with PM Modi, describing the move as a gesture of "friendship and respect."

Budget 2026: 7 key takeaways for individual taxpayersThe Union Budget 2026 may not have changed income tax rates, but it brings several practical updates that affect how individuals file returns, disclose income and deal with compliance. From easier timelines to simpler rules, here are the key takeaways taxpayers should know.

Silver ETF takes a hit: Down Rs 2 lakh, what should investors do now?On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), silver prices have dropped sharply from their record peak, while gold has also seen a strong correction.

Silver prices crash Rs 17,000 today. More correction ahead?After touching record highs in recent weeks, silver prices have cooled sharply. The metal has slipped by nearly Rs 17,000, prompting investors to pause and reassess whether this fall is a buying opportunity or a sign to stay cautious.
Sensex ends 944 points higher: Why stock market rose today?The S&P BSE Sensex rallied 943.52 points to close at 81,666.46, while the NSE Nifty50 added 262.95 points to end at 25,088.40.

From stronger banks to easier credit: Who stands to gain from Budget 2026?A key announcement in the Budget was the proposal to set up a High-Level Committee on Banking for Viksit Bharat. The committee will undertake a comprehensive review of the sector and suggest reforms to align it with India's next stage of economic growth.

entertainment.headline: Draco Malfoy posters go viral during Chinese New Year 2026. Here's why Chinese New Year celebrations in 2026 see a unique trend as Draco Malfoy from the Harry Potter series becomes a symbol of good fortune, with his image appearing on decorations across China due to a play on words in his Chinese name.

Akshaye Khanna, Sunny Deol face off in Ikka; internet says Rehman Dakait is back Netflix released the teaser of Ikka featuring Sunny Deol and Akshaye Khanna in a tense courtroom drama. The teaser has generated attention online with fans showering the two actors with love and praise.

Family Business: Anil Kapoor, Vijay Varma team up for Hansal Mehta's Netflix drama Netflix is set to release a new series titled Family Business, directed by Hansal Mehta. It explores the complexities of power, succession, and betrayal within one of India's largest business conglomerates.

Arjun Kapoor on mother Mona's birth anniversary: Life's been cruel to me lately Arjun Kapoor got emotional on his mother Mona Shourie Kapoor's birth anniversary. He expressed his admiration for his late mother's dignified and graceful persona on social media.

Why BTS' Netflix documentary could be a defining moment for the band BTS returns to the global stage with a Netflix documentary that captures their reunion, growth and the making of ARIRANG. Here's why it marks a turning point for the band.

Chappell Roan defends topless Grammy gown: Don't even think this is that outrageous Chappell Roan defended her daring sheer gown at the 68th Grammy Awards. Her outfit led to outrage from a section of internet users.

Is Sai Pallavi replacing Deepika Padukone as SUM-80 in Kalki 2? Makers clarify The makers of Kalki 2898 AD 2 have addressed speculations around Sai Pallavi replacing Deepika Padukone in the film. The film also features Prabhas, Amitabh Bachchan, and Kamal Haasan in key roles.

Mumbai Police register case against Dhurandhar 2 team over unauthorised drone use Mumbai Police have filed a case against the location manager of the film Dhurandhar 2 after the crew used a drone without proper authorisation in the high-security Fort area, leading to an FIR under Section 223 of the IPC.

Farhan Akhtar will take time to get over 120 Bahadur failure: Mother Honey Irani Farhan Akhtar's mother, Honey Irani, talked about how he's coping with the box office failure of 120 Bahadur. She also commented on his plans to make Jee Le Zaraa.

Border 2 actor Medha Rana on online trolling: You simply can't please everybody In an exclusive interview with India Today, actor Medha Rana opened up about dealing with trolls and criticism, sharing that she leans on Varun Dhawan's advice to let her work speak louder than anything else.

Neena Gupta recalls telling Masaba she didn't fit the Hindi film heroine image Neena Gupta shared that daughter Masaba Gupta once aspired to be a traditional Bollywood heroine but was given an honest reality check about industry standards.

Is Dhurandhar: The Revenge teaser same as 1st film's post-credit scene? Explained Dhurandhar: The Revenge teaser has sparked debate online, with fans pointing out that it's the same post-credit scene already seen in theatres and on OTT. But is there anything new?

Did Dhurandhar's end credits confirm Ranveer Singh's multiple vanity vans? Dhurandhar's end credits have fans spotting multiple vans linked to Ranveer Singh. This discovery has sparked fresh debate over the actor's on-set arrangements and immersive acting style.

Prince Narula reveals why he took up The 50, reacts to 'mentor' row Prince Narula, who is currently participating in The 50, opened up about his decision to participate in the reality show with his wife, Yuvika Chaudhary. He also reacted to several fans questioning his decision to participate in a show with contestants whom he had mentored at one point.

Dhurandhar felt like a Pakistani made it: Social media user claiming to be from Pak A man claiming to be Pakistani has said that director Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar felt nostalgic. He also praised the accuracy of Urdu and Karachi vibes in the film.

Lisa Ray celebrates 25 years of Kasoor, calls it a turning point in her career Lisa Ray celebrated 25 years of Kasoor, reflecting on how the film empowered her with a strong, emotionally complex role that defied Bollywood norms of the time.

Border 2 box office Day 11: Sunny's film crosses Rs 280 crore mark despite Monday dip Sunny Deol's 'Border 2' has crossed Rs 281 crore at the box office in its first 11 days, maintaining robust earnings despite a notable decline on its second Monday.

Rajinikanth honours frontline worker Padma, gifts her gold chain. See pics Actor Rajinikanth honoured Padma, a sanitation worker in Chennai, with a gold chain after she returned 45 sovereigns of lost gold, recognising her integrity and service. Photos of Rajinikanth with her family went viral.

Ranbir Kapoor's Ramayana to be unveiled on Ram Navami at Gateway of India: Report Ranbir Kapoor's Ramayana will unveil its first character looks at a grand Ram Navami event at Mumbai's Gateway of India, with cast and political leaders expected.

general news.headline: DGCA rejoinder to Air India fuel switch scare adds 'incorrect direction' twist to rowThe incident, which brought back focus on the June 2025 Air India crash in Ahmedabad, occurred on flight AI-132 before it took off from London's Heathrow airport for Bengaluru.

Best US trade deal in neighbourhood: Govt hits back at Opposition criticismPiyush Goyal said that India got the best trade deal with the US when compared to neighbouring countries, highlighting benefits for farmers, MSMEs, and key industries. He also slammed Opposition disruptions in the Lok Sabha, calling their conduct "disgraceful" during the trade deal debate.

Gandhi statue cut, stolen in Australia, India demands immediate actionIndia has reacted strongly after a statue of Mahatma Gandhi at the Australian Indian Community Centre in Rowville, Melbourne, Australia, was stolen.

Lok Sabha chaos over Rahul Gandhi's ex-Army chief memoir mention, 8 MPs suspendedThe Lok Sabha witnessed chaos as Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi was stopped from continuing his speech on the President's address, sparking protests and heated exchanges. The incident highlighted tensions over parliamentary rules and India-China relations amid a sharp political confrontation.
Dear Pushpas, a trade deal is a duet, not a duelA bilateral agreement, like the India-US trade deal, isn't about outright victory or defeat. There are gives and takes, and deals within deals.

Paris prosecutors raid offices of Elon Musk's X offices across FranceA search was being carried out at the French offices of Elon Musk's social media platform X as part of an investigation opened in January 2025, the Paris prosecutor's office said Tuesday.

WhatsApp to leave India? Privacy issue that made Supreme Court angry, explainedDespite the Supreme Court's stern warning over data-sharing and privacy, WhatsApp is not immediately set to leave India but the coming weeks could decide how it must operate here.

The DJ who changed the tone: Sergio Gor and India-US resetSergio Gor took charge as US envoy on a chilly January 12 morning. His goal was to return the warmth that has shaped India-US ties for decades. And, he seems to have delivered within a month. Read to find out how.

Why Rahul Gandhi is right about Doklam area and 2020, wrong about Doklam tanksHandcrafted ByOur Editors Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi cited an incident of "four Chinese tanks advancing towards Indian positions", saying it was at Doklam in 2020. He was referring to an article based on an unpublished book by ex-Army Chief Gen MM Naravane (Retd). While the Congress leader was correct about the year, when Doklam area also saw Chinese military advance as part of the broader tensions along the LAC, he was wrong about the location. The tank movement was at Rechin La, and not Doklam.

Live: India-US trade deal under final touches, joint statement soon, says ministerIndia-US Trade Deal Live Updates: US President Donald Trump has announced a cut in tariffs on Indian goods from 25 per cent to 18 per cent after speaking with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, signalling an easing of strained ties. PM Modi welcomed the move, saying "Made in India" products would now face lower tariffs and thanked Trump for the decision. The US President said the cut followed PM's request and reflected friendship and respect. Trump also said a long-pending India-US trade deal is now close, despite earlier disagreements, especially over agriculture. He added that PM had agreed to reduce purchases of Russian oil and shift imports towards the US and Venezuela. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Gold medal for chaos: Cricket a glorious mess before much-awaited Olympics returnThe T20 World Cup 2026, featuring 20 teams, was meant to showcase cricket's global future. Instead, it has revived old habits, dragging the sport back into familiar, self-made chaos. With two years to go before cricket's Olympic return, the ICC needs to set its house in order.

When Dubai answered to Delhi: The forgotten India–Gulf connectionLong before oil transformed Dubai, the city was closely tied to British India. From Indian passports and the Indian rupee to administrators reporting to Delhi, large parts of today's Gulf were once governed through India. Here's the fascinating history behind that forgotten connection.

Dhurandhar 2 teaser: Ranveer Singh is back as Hamza with more gore and chaosDhurandhar: The Revenge teaser promises Ranveer Singh in a darker, deadlier avatar. The spy-action thriller, sequel to Dhurandhar, is scheduled to release on March 19, 2026, in multiple Indian languages.

Sensex ends 2,000 points higher: Here's why the stock market jumped todayThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 2,072.67 points to close at 83,739.13, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 639.15 points to settle at 25,727.55. The Nifty recorded its best single-day gain since May 2025, showing a strong return of buying interest after recent weakness.

What's behind Trump's change of heart for India?Donald Trump's abrupt shift from tariff threats and sharp criticism of India to warm praise for Prime Minister Narendra Modi and a reduced-tariff trade deal has surprised diplomatic and trade circles. What's behind Trump's change of heart for India?

Heard nothing from India on stopping oil buys: Russia on Trump trade deal commentsThe statement came a day after US President Donald Trump announced a trade deal with India that would result in the imposition of significantly reduced tariffs of 18%.

Women are being secretly filmed with smart glasses. You could be next!Women's safety has hit a new low, with technology designed for convenience now being turned into tools of harassment. Case in point: smart glasses.

EC trying to save face, shouted at us: Mamata Banerjee trashes poll panel's defenceMamata Banerjee's remarks came a day after the Election Commission categorically rejected her allegations, denying any mistreatment during the 90-minute meeting with CEC Gyanesh Kumar over the conduct of SIR exercise in the state.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 20 | Bearded Beginning: Rebel's Roots And Rationalist RoarI have not just been reading, researching, writing and speaking on Periyar from my early years, but in the process internalised and imbibed him impulsively, instinctively and now I fear, irrevocably. He has got under my skin and settled in my system so pervasively I almost feel I am growing a beard.

You can't address Chair as yaar: Lok Sabha raps Congress MP amid chaosLok Sabha proceedings resumed today on a stormy note, with tempers running high over Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's bid to cite excerpts from former Army chief General MM Naravane's unpublished memoir. 

Amid the din, Speaker Krishna Prasad Tenneti pulled up a member for using the word "yaar" during the heated exchange, reminding MPs to maintain parliamentary decorum. 

He stressed that such expressions were unacceptable when addressing the Chair and urged members to confine their remarks to the discussion on the Motion of Thanks to the President's Address.

Why has Niagara Falls frozen? Breathtaking ice cliffs take overTourists braved sub-zero temperatures to witness partially frozen cascades, ice-encrusted trees, and misty vapours creating an otherworldly scene.

No noise, no Nobel support: How PM got Trump to blink on tariffs and trade dealHandcrafted ByOur Editors Trump tariffs: PM Modi, without any confrontation or provocation, let patience do the heavy lifting. Eventually, the US's loudest dealmaker blinked, without PM Modi having to say a word or resorting to massaging Trump's ego.

PM is compromised, sold the nation: Rahul Gandhi's big charge on US trade dealRahul Gandhi hit out at the Central government over the US trade deal, claiming that the deal was signed under pressure from Donald Trump.

Is Trump's US-India trade deal even Trump-proof?President Donald Trump announced that the US and India had agreed to a trade deal wherein tariffs on Indian exports to the US would drop from 50% to 18%. Is any agreement with the US even Trump-proof? Trump acts on whims and fancies, and countries like South Korea, the UK and Canada have seen that trade agreements don't mean much when it comes to sanctions.

sports.headline: GG vs DC WPL 2026 Eliminator Live Score: Can Delhi qualify for 4th straight final? Gujarat Giants vs Delhi Capitals, WPL Eliminator 2026: Delhi Capitals women will take on Gujarat Giants in the Eliminator fixture of the Women's Premier League 2026. Delhi are eyeing to seal their spot in the third successive final while Gujarat are looking to enter their first final.

Gold medal for chaos: Cricket a glorious mess before much-awaited Olympics return The T20 World Cup 2026, featuring 20 teams, was meant to showcase cricket's global future. Instead, it has revived old habits, dragging the sport back into familiar, self-made chaos. With two years to go before cricket's Olympic return, the ICC needs to set its house in order.

Alcaraz was like baby Nadal: Ex-tennis player recalls incredible story The Australian Open champion, Carlos Alcaraz, was just 14 when he first left a seasoned top-10 professional searching for answers. More than a decade later, Spain's Davis Cup captain David Ferrer believes that fleeting practice-court moment already carried unmistakable shades of a young Rafael Nadal.

Pakistan shouldn't play vs India, was ICC sleeping before? Former cricketer Former Pakistan cricketer Kamran Akmal supports PCB's decision to boycott the India match in the T20 World Cup 2026, citing ICC's biased approach. Pakistan's government has denied permission to its cricket team to play against India in the tournament.

Gavaskar trolls Pakistan over T20 World Cup stand: Waiting for their U-turn T20 World Cup: Legendary Sunil Gavaskar has trolled Pakistan over their stand of boycotting India in the T20 World Cup 2026. Gavaskar said that he is awaiting a U-turn that Pakistani players are infamously known for.

T20 World Cup boycott row: What Pakistan risks by forfeiting India match T20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan could face severe sanctions if it goes ahead and forfeits their match against India. While Pakistan has confirmed participation in the tournament, its refusal to face India in Sri Lanka has opened the door to possible ICC sanctions.

WPL 2026 Eliminator: Gujarat chase first final against Jemimah's Capitals Delhi Capitals and Gujarat Giants collide in a do-or-die WPL 2026 Eliminator in Vadodara. With a final spot at stake, recent thrillers suggest another nerve-shredding finish awaits.

Tests over T20? Cummins says he did not want to risk himself for World Cup Australia fast bowler Pat Cummins has broken his silence on missing the T20 World Cup. Cummins has explained why he did not want to risk himself in the world tournament.

Karim Benzema joins Al Hilal: How the transfer caused a Ronaldo riot in Saudi Benzema's move to Al-Hilal and Ronaldo's protest have exposed cracks in Saudi football's power balance. What began as squad building has spiralled into a league-wide debate on fairness, control and ambition.

CSK in WPL? Team to start investing in women's cricket, reveals CEO Chennai Super Kings are set to invest in women's cricket, confirmed the team's CEO Kasi Viswanathan. Till now, CSK has stayed away from investing in women's cricket despite the advent of the WPL.

Despite thrashing vs Pakistan, Ponting backs Australia to reach top 4 in T20 WCT20 World Cup: Former cricketer Ricky Ponting has backed Australia to reach the semi-final of the T20 World Cup. Ponting has shown confidence in the side, despite the team getting battered by Pakistan in the 3-match T20I series.

Watch: Ishan Kishan cracks up revisiting old viral clip with Rohit SharmaIshan Kishan burst into laughter revisiting an old viral clip with Rohit Sharma, joking about how three missed matches turned into two lost years. The throwback landed just as his red-hot form reignited his T20 World Cup push.

Sky turns blue again: Suryakumar Yadav's timely rise ahead of T20 World CupIndia's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav was enduring horrendous form in the lead-up to the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026. However, just 1 month ahead of the tournament, the sky has turned blue once again for the India skipper.

ISL picks FanCode over JioHotstar: Value drops from Rs 1.68 cr to Rs 9.5 lakhFanCode has announced as the new broadcast partner of the Indian Super League after beating JioStar in the bidding war. The deal finally clears the way for the delayed ISL season to restart on February 14.

Pakistan pulling off a drama with India boycott in T20 World Cup: HarbhajanHarbhajan Singh has torn into Pakistan's India-match boycott call, calling it staged drama. The former spinner challenged the PCB to hold its nerve and avoid another familiar U-turn at the T20 World Cup.

Why did Ronaldo not play in Al Nassr vs Al Riyadh? Controversy explainedCristiano Ronaldo's unexplained absence from Al Nassr's league clash has ignited strike rumours and exposed growing tensions behind the scenes. At stake is not fitness, but power, ambition, and his future in Saudi football itself.

Legal or illegal? Indian umpire gives verdict on Usman Tariq's bowling actionFormer umpire Anil Chaudhary has declared Usman Tariq's bowling action legal after scrutiny in the Australia series. The decision comes amid debates sparked by Cameron Green's on-field gestures and previous suspicions in the Pakistan Super League.

Sri Lanka back Kamindu Mendis for T20 World Cup, Dhananjaya de Silva dropped from squadSri Lanka have recalled Kamindu Mendis to their T20 World Cup squad despite his modest returns in the format, while the co-hosts have opted to leave out veteran all-rounder Dhananjaya de Silva.

USA send T20 World Cup warning with strong show against India A in warm-up gameUSA delivered a strong performance against India A in the T20 World Cup 2026 warm-up match. Tilak Varma's fitness return and Ravi Bishnoi's performance were the major positives for India in the fixture.

IND vs NZ: KCA acts on inflated water prices during Thiruvananthapuram T20IKerala Cricket Association has launched an investigation into inflated water prices for fans during the India vs New Zealand fifth T20I in Thiruvananthapuram. Several videos and posts circulating on social media showed spectators being charged above the permitted rates at certain sections of the Greenfield International stadium.

AUS vs ENG, U19 World Cup semi-final Live Streaming: When and where to watchU19 World Cup: Australia and England are all set to face each other in the first semi-final of the tournament on Tuesday, February 3 in Bulawayo. Both teams are unbeaten, having won all their five matches.

Carlos Alcaraz withdraws from Rotterdam Open hours after maiden Australian Open titleCarlos Alcaraz withdrew from the ABN AMRO Open in Rotterdam on Monday, just hours after clinching his maiden Australian Open title. The Spaniard, who lifted the trophy at the ATP 500 event last season, will not return to defend his crown at the indoor hard-court tournament.

No India-Pakistan game in T20 World Cup may cause USD 250 million losses to ICCNo India-Pakistan match in the T20 World Cup 2026, scheduled to be played in Colombo, could cause significant financial losses to ICC to the tune of USD 250 million, according to estimates. The Pakistan government has asked its team not to participate in the India fixture but play the entire tournament.

BCCI's handling of Mustafizur saga sparked T20 World Cup crisis: ex-ICC officialFormer International Cricket Council (ICC) Head of Communications Sami-ul-Hasan Burney on Monday said the BCCI could have avoided the current T20 World Cup turmoil by handling Bangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman's IPL exit with greater discretion.

Umpiring blunder? Pakistan keeper makes foolish stumping error, but gets luckyPakistan wicketkeeper Khawaja Nafay made a controversial stumping to dismiss Cooper Connolly off Mohammad Nawaz. On Sunday, Pakistan beat Australia by 111 runs to sweep the T20I series 3-0.

T20 World Cup warm-up: Tilak Varma's brisk 38 sparks hopes of swift comebackTilak Varma returned to competitive cricket after recovering from an abdominal injury. His strong performance raises hopes for India in the upcoming T20 World Cup but sparks selection challenges.

Meg Lanning, fuelled with fire, confirms WPL 2027 return after horror seasonMeg Lanning has confirmed her return to the Women's Premier League in 2027 after a difficult season with UP Warriorz. Her comeback signals a strong desire to compete and lead despite recent challenges.

Mary Kom apologises for 'didn't earn a single rupee' dig at ex-husband OnlerIndian boxing icon Mary Kom has issued a public apology after her remarks about ex-husband K Onler Kom on a television chat show sparked backlash on social media. The comments were made during an emotional discussion about her personal life and have kept the six-time world champion in the spotlight in recent weeks.

Is Mohsin Naqvi now cricket's troublemaker-in-chief?From handshake rows to World Cup boycotts, Mohsin Naqvi has kept cricket on edge. His confrontations with India have turned administration into spectacle, dragging the game into politics instead of letting it breathe.

Pakistan travel to Sri Lanka for T20 World Cup 2026 amid India boycott stancePakistan cricket team has left for Sri Lanka to participate in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026 after their government denied them permission to play against India. This boycott raises concerns from the ICC and may affect Pakistan's cricketing future globally.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
